fields.headline: Referee dismisses Cisse red card
fields.bodyText: The Birmingham midfielder Aliou Cissé has had the red card he received at Arsenal on Sunday rescinded by the referee Mike Riley and will not serve a suspension. But some senior figures at the Football Association were last night considering whether to investigate Ashley Cole for his part in the incident. Cissé was dismissed after a second booking for a tackle on Cole but his manager Steve Bruce asked Riley to review the incident on video and the official decided the challenge did not warrant a caution. Charlton have appealed against Paul Konchesky's sending off for an alleged elbow on Chelsea's Enrique de Lucas at the weekend. Fulham's Barry Hayles has escaped FA punishment over a misconduct charge following a clash with Everton last December. Crystal Palace's reserve goalkeeper Alex Kolinko wants to leave the club following his fracas with the manager Trevor Francis. Kolinko will attend a meeting with the Professional Footballers' Association next week but is keen to get his contract paid up. David Ginola, released by Everton during the summer, is considering retiring to become a film actor. "David will announce what he plans to do at the end of the month," said his agent Chantal Stanley. "He could end his career in order to become a film actor. Or else he might decide to take a sabbatical year, as he can carry on playing as long as he likes."
